data.title: Dinner out
data.text: This is our fav Greek in town. The patitso is excellent as is the moussaka. We usually get a sampler and split it with an extra salad. Fresh, authentic and delicious. The restaurant could use a good cleaning and decluttering but otherwise a fab place to go.

data.title: Authentic and great
data.text: If you love authentic Mediterranean food, this is the place to go.  I happened upon it one Friday night, while walking around historic downtown, and it was great, there was nothing I ordered, which was not very good, with hefty portions.

data.title: Getting out of the house
data.text: The food was good.   We arrived an hour before closing.  They had run out of several items.   That said, it was still a nice meal and the atmosphere was pretty good.

data.title: Avoid this dreck and go to Papa Gyro's on University Dr.
data.text:
This eaterie is located on the south side of the square across from the courthouse. I am convinced it survives because it feeds jurors and lawyers during lunch breaks. There is no other reason to go there than its proximity to the courthouse.

The atmosphere is dreary and blah and you're in a long, narrow room with tables juxtaposed willy nilly. You'll see dozens of lawyers and judges holding forth at the bigger tables, and the room is so small you can't have a private conversation.

The food is just blah.

Greek food is their specialty (supposedly) but they have daily specials that aren't Greek.

The overall taste of the food is just bland. It tastes stale, with not spices to tickle your tongue or excite your palate.

Papa Gyro's on University Drive, conversely, is phenomenal. I've eaten at Papou's  three times and Papa Gyros more than a dozen.

That should tell you something.

Skip Papou's and go to Papa's. It's that simple.

data.title: Great lunch.
data.text: Stopped here based on Trip Advisor reviews.  Place was empty.  I ordered the gyro with cole slaw.  The gyro was very good and the cole slaw was great.  Slaw was made with Greek dressing and feta cheese.  Would return food this slaw alone.  Decor is nice but nothing special.  Staff was very attentive and friendly.  Food arrived quickly.  Quality of food compared to price was very good. Recommended.

data.title: Pleasantly Surprised
data.text:
Cute and Quant little place. Nice quiet atmosphere with lovely old Hollywood tunes lightly playing in the background.
Had the Grecian  Salad. The greens were a fresh assortment of lettuces and the grilled chicken was marinated with a light flavor. The dressing was not over powering the salad. It was a large portion and very good.
Great location, on the South side of the Courthouse. Parking at meters or in the garage down the street. 
Price was about what you may expect to pay for a salad.

data.title: Authentic Greek food - family owned
data.text: We had dinner there before the holidays.  Excellent roast leg of lamb - tender and served in it's own juices.  Entrees come with soup, salad, bread, and a side dish.  Service was very attentive but not overly cloying as you sometimes see.  Wine menu features some very nice Greek import wines.  So overall very competitive pricing for a downtown Huntsville restaurant for dinner.   Will definitely go there again.

data.title: Not bad but certainly not the best Greek food in Huntsville
data.text:
This is a cozy little restaurant on the court house square downtown. 
The good- The location, ambience and staff are fantastic.  The menu had good variety and the prices are quite reasonable.
The bad-  While Mediterranean food of this sort is not known for it's excessive spiciness, we found this to be rather bland even by that standard.  We had a sampler plate with mousakka, spankopada and pasticho.

data.title: A little taste of Greece
data.text: A very cozy little place on the square in downtown Huntsville, AL. The place does not seat very many but has a nice atmosphere. Service is much like what you would receive in Europe - very relaxed. If you are in a hurry, I would not recommend this place, but if you have some time, it is a great place for dinner. The food and the service was very good. Not too expensive and portion sizes are adequate. Great for a romantic evening.

data.title: GREAT GREEK
data.text: Great authentic Greek fare.  Always go on Thursday for the Chicken Lunch Special.  You can't go wrong the Gyro and save room for the delicious baklava.

data.title: Family owned on the square
data.text: My wife had read about this place in the old square, and it was close to our next stop. The atmosphere is okay. Since it's a smallish kind of place, we could tell that a lot of the patrons were locals and apparently enjoying themselves. Our food was above average. Our server was adequate, but not overly friendly or attentive...he got the job done. We saw some really nice dinners being delivered around our table and the people relishing them. Worth trying out.

data.title: Good Food, Disappointing Service
data.text:
A couple of colleagues and I dropped in for lunch away from our conference. The food was good, but a colleague with Celiac's disease had a very hard time communicating her needs to the waitress. After figuring out she could only have a salad, we still had to send it back after the kitchen made it with croutons. 

Seems like a nice hole-in-the-wall lunch place, but avoid if you have food sensitivities.

data.title: Don't eat the fish!
data.text: Listen,  the people were friendly and service with atmosphere were great.  My co-worker and I had the fish which had a sauce on it and a squash casserole.  Now understand my co-worker and I rarely leave food on our plates and we are easy to please.  But the fish literally tasted like it had been floating dead for a couple of days before it was filleted and cooked.  We stopped eating and that means it was pretty bad.

data.title: Nice restaurant downtown Huntsville
data.text: My wife and I had lunch (lamb) there.  Food and service was good; pricing just about right.  We felt fortunate to be able to park so close.

data.title: Irate Server Alert!
data.text: I have been to this restaurant about half a dozen times. The food is marginal, but I work in the area and often my first choices are packed and it is default. They have a server who has not once, but twice thrown a fit in front of patrons and acted out like a spoiled child expressing his anger. Last night we ended up there because the wait for Cotton Row was longer than we had time for, and the same waiter we saw pitch a fit over something the previous time we were there, loudly treated a trainee served like a bad dog and then proceed to yell at two patrons who decided to leave the restaurant (likely because of his ill tempered behavior). The question here is: Why does management keep this half-cocked jerk on the floor? There are plenty of better servers who need jobs. This server is disorganized and terrible....add yelling at customers to get out after chanting "tick tock - tick tock - tick tock - tick -tock" in their faces as they were trying to tell him thy they were leaving, and you have a veritable psychopath.

data.title: They Charge for Extra Bread!!!
data.text: We went to Papous on a Saturday night and celebrated a birthday with about 14 other people. Our server was not prepared for such a large group. The drinks came quickly, the food took forever. Our table had our food half eaten before the other table was served. The food was good, but we can do as well at home. They bring out one basket of bread for the table. If one of the guests eats more than one and you ask for more, there is a charge, but they do not tell you until you get the bill. Seriously??!! I recommend Pappous for a couple, do not expect great food, and do not eat more than one piece of bread. We will not return.

data.title: VERY DELICIOUS, UNIQUE FOOD
data.text: We ordered the Hummus, Spanikopita, Moussaka, and Baklava.  It was fresh and very delicious.  The only slight drawback was the bread in the Hummus plate, which did not taste quite right.

data.title: AWESOME
data.text: The lunch special short ribs, turnip greens & mashed with a side of corn bread. Melt in your mouth meat seasoned to perfection. I can hardly wait for tomorrow's special! Wanted to order the weeks worth of specials today so wouldn't miss them :) Always great fast service. Don't miss your next great meal stop in.

data.title: Not even close to authentic
data.text: My husband and I ate here recently because we had a Groupon coupon.  This was the second time we had eaten here over the years, and the last.  During the whole meal I kept thinking of all the other places we could have gone for dinner.  I am hard pressed to mention anything that we ate that was good.  It was overcooked, tasteless, underwhelming.  The worst meal we had in Greece was still better than this one.  This is not what Greek food should taste like.

data.title: Not like any Greek Food I ever had
data.text: My wife and I lived in Europe for 17 years while serving in the Army and I can tell you that Papou's food is nothing like any Greek food that we ever had.  The only thing close was an appetizer, (Saganaki).  Our main courses looked and tasted nothing like the Greek food we were used too.  Very disappointing as I guess the restaurant is trying to tailor their food to local taste.  Another surprise was that Papou’s does not serve Gyros on its dinner menu.  All said and done, a very disappointing experience.
